metadata.title: Global parameters for all request types

sections.chapter: Working with the built-in capabilities of the SDK
sections.title: Global parameters for all request types

inlineContent.text: We already know how to create and perform
, and

. However, each of them can have additional parameters, which are called global parameters because they are specified globally for all requests. The SDK provides the ability to add global parameters once so that you don’t have to copy them when creating each request.
We will continue to build the app, so be sure to follow all the previous tutorials. You can download
which has already implemented all steps from this tutorial.

file. We start with updating the
The first thing we need to do is add an alert state. We will display it immediately after creating the
In a real-world app, your value of
has to be a Base64-encoded string with consent data in
The next step will be to create a method that will process the user’s choice and generate the GDPR consent.
Now let’s take a look at the
All we had to do is add an alert. After that, you can launch the app and make sure everything works.
App can ask users about their consent for sharing information with third parties in accordance with the GDPR. In this section, we will add an alert that will ask for this permission.
In this section, we’ll configure the GDPR parameter for each request that we have in our app. In addition, we will review the possibility of removing global parameters.
Let’s continue working in the
and focus on the
method.
First of all, we set the GDPR parameter for all future
s. For this, we use the
method. The method uses the
for the properties of the
class.
is not the only global parameter for
. A list of all common global parameters can be found in the
documentation. A list of all global parameters that are only relevant to
can be found in the
documentation.
In addition, sometimes you need to be able to remove the global
parameter. You can use
for this purpose.

and

and

Just like with

abstract.text: The SDK supports a persistent cache with resources related to ad, these can be banners or other resources, depending on the type of ad. In this tutorial, we’ll look at how an application developer can control the cache.
AdSDK provides powerful functionality for user tagging and conversion tracking. In this tutorial, we will look at this functionality.

The SDK supports a persistent cache with resources related to ad, these can be banners or other resources, depending on the type of ad. In this tutorial, we’ll look at how an application developer can control the cache.
This tutorial will guide you how to create and display inline ads. An inline ad is an ad created to be displayed in your view hierarchy.

abstract.text: Manage, display, and create your custom advertisements on iOS using cutting-edge technologies such as Structured Concurrency, and SwiftUI.
A full-screen advertisement that fills the host app’s interface is known as an interstitial ad. In this tutorial we are going to add interstitial ad into our application.
